entry.title: Reading List 2014-March-27
entry.content:
General

  1. Verizon Knows Your WiFi SSID and Key at WLAN Book.com and @WLANBook.com
  2. Bright Lights, Big Data | The New Yorker

Cloud

  1. AWS Price Reduction #42 – EC2, S3, RDS, ElastiCache, and Elastic MapReduce | Amazon Web Services Blog
  2. AWS Achieves DoD Provisional Authorization
  3. Amazon WorkSpaces is Now Available
  4. New VPC Peering for the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud

Software development

  1. Google I/O 2014 | Google Developers Blog
  2. Disturbing Misinterpretations: No One Knows What the F*** They’re Doing
  3. Microsoft open-sources MS-DOS. ’80s kids dance in the streets
  4. The Programmer Productivity Paradox
  5. The Mixed Blessings of Compatibility
  6. Project Asteroid: Gracefully Dropping Support for Dinosaur Browsers in Trello
  7. POC, Prototype, or Pilot? When and Why
  8. Clojure web security is worse than you think

Android

  1. Android SDK For Full Body Motion Control

Java

  1. jdeps: JDK 8 Command-line Static Dependency Checker
  2. Difference between WeakReference vs SoftReference vs PhantomReference vs Strong reference in Java
  3. Spring: Choosing the Right Dependency Injection Approach
  4. An Embedded Java 8 Lambda Expression Microbenchmark
  5. Documenting your Spring API with Swagger
  6. Oracle Java 8 Launched with Lambda Expressions for Parallelism
  7. Spring AOP Example Tutorial – Aspect, Advice, Pointcut, JoinPoint, Annotations, XML Configuration
  8. The Biggest Flaw of Spring Web Applications
  9. Detecting WebSocket Connects and Disconnects in Spring 4

Scala

  1. Using Scala Will Make You Less Productive
  2. Easy Dependency Injection in Play Framework with Scaldi
  3. Polymorphism, and typeclasses in Scala.
  4. A SQL query DSL for Scala by ScalikeJDBC

entry.title: Scala for the Intrigued
entry.content:
This is a very nice series of posts about Scala by Venkat Subramaniam

  1. The Elegance of Scala
  2. Sensible Typing and Optional Items
  3. Cute Classes and Pure OO
  4. Functional Style of Programming
  5. Working with Collections
  6. Creating Higher Order Functions
  7. Pattern Matching
  8. XML as First Class Citizen
  9. Recursions and Tail Call Optimization
  10. Using Traits
  11. Chaining Traits
  12. Concurrency in Scala
